section.section: Subject to subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, this subtitle and any agreement made under it do not impair the right and responsibility of the Montgomery Commission to create, alter, combine, contract out, or abolish a job classification, department, operation, unit, or other division or service.

The Montgomery Commission may undertake the contracting of work that will displace employees only if the Montgomery Commission gives written notice to the certified representative at least 90 days before signing the contract or within a different period that is agreed to by the parties.

Paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection does not prohibit the Montgomery Commission from allowing employees to negotiate or to confer with the Montgomery Commission over labor matters during work hours without the loss of pay or time.
